data.title: It's Greek to me
data.text: There are not a lot of Greek restaurants in this area and this one is the best.  It's on a main street in downtown Kent.  They have a large room in the back if you have a party or group.  The spanakopita is very delicious with crisp phyllo dough.  The gyros are also very good and they make a very nice Greek salad.  I am not fond of tzatziki but other people I've dined with all loved it.

data.title: Greek?
data.text: My husband I were so excited to have a Greek restaurant so close.  We had been used to Athens Greek Taverna in San Diego where my friend Mary Papas serves only the best.  The ambience at Spiros is perfect so it was with great relish that we placed out order.  First the Saganaki…bland and tasteless and dry.  Second my Pastitsio..fell apart on my plate it was so dry.  My husband had lamb and he said it was more edible than mine but again …tasteless.  We felt so bad.  The service was outstanding the restaurant charming.  I gave up and came home and learned to make my now Pastitsio.  Sorry Spiros.  Call Mary Papas and ask her to come and work with your cooks.

data.title: Hot Dinner
data.text: My husband and I have had dinner dinner before here but it was fun to go again after having actually visited Greece this year. Food was very good as always and service exceptional. We really wish they had A/C here, however--hot, hot summer. Unbearable inside and close to unbearable outside.

data.title: GREAT GREEK FOOD!  TEMP Closed for remodeling - scheduled to open 11/3/2015
data.text: Frequented this establishment often with a hungry teen after karate class in DT Kent.  Tzatziki sauce is best ever.  Good bar drinks - I recommend the Malibu Barbie, Gyro platter and baklava.  Reasonable and enough food for a 2nd serving.  Long time Kent establishment.  Can't wait to see what they did to renovate the place.  Look forward to the reopening. OPA!

data.title: good food, fast service, save your money!
data.text:
I've been here for lunch maybe 4 times because it's close to my work, and each time I have come away very satisfied.  The service is quick and friendly, the food comes in generous, delicious portions, and the tab is quite reasonable.  Last year I went to Greece on a two-week vacation, so olives and tzatziki and pita wraps are on my mind a lot.  I'm grateful to have a good place to go for a good meal.

Note: I haven't been there for the evening show but hear it's delightful!

data.title: Delicious Greek Food
data.text: Ducked into this establishment for the first time during Kent Cornucopia days. We had a group of 5 dining in for lunch. we were seated in the back of the restaurant. It was pretty warm inside, but they had some fans going. I ordered the Spanakopita. It was served with a tossed greek salad and vegetables. Very good taste! The waitress was super talkative, friendly and outgoing. I'm so glad we finally got to experience what every one has been talking about.  I hear there are sometimes belly dancers here too. I would love to come back to check it out.

data.title: Great food and mediocre service
data.text: The food here is great.  The service is not.  We came for dinner when they were not real busy.  We attempted to order two items only to be told they were out of those.  They hadn't started their dinner rush yet as it was about 5:00pm on a Thursday.  I ordered a Greek beer with my entree and had to remind the waitress who, then, brought the wrong beer.  We did receive our entrees fairly quickly and they, as always, had amazing flavor.  Overall, Spiro's is worth visiting for the food; just take the service with a grain of salt.

data.title: Dinner on a hot evening
data.text: We went to Spiros because I am new to the area, love greek, and saw all the great reviews. We sat outside bc there is no air conditioning. We had dolmades, salads and chicken souvlaki platters for dinner. The food was pretty good. I really enjoyed the dolmades served with tzaiki sauce. The salad and dressing was also delicious. Overall it was OK. My boyfriend thinks Ishtar is better! If we go back I will stick to a salad. Overall this place was just okay.

data.title: VW
data.text: We ordered different dishes. Food was average. Not spectacular but OK. Nice location in downtown Kent. Walking distance from shopping center, cinema, restaurants and county courthouse.

data.title: Pretty good
data.text: The woman that served us was very friendly and did a great job, it was very warm and stuffy in there though. The Spanakopita was our least favorite....they tasted like they were way remade and heated up in a microwave leaving them really chewy and not crisp at all....I had an open faced gyro and enjoyed it pretty well...they give you a huge serving for whatever you order. My husband enjoyed the lamb souvlaki. My one major gripe is they give you way too much lettuce on your plate.

data.title: The islands at home
data.text:
We are fans of Greek food.  While we have never been to Greece, if Spiros is any example of what it would be like, I am ready to go.

Food good and wonderful service

data.title: Greek food in Kent? Go here!
data.text: If your go here for anything, go for a fantastic salad.  After that, have Baklava.  You don't need anything else!  We have been here several times with family when we want something a little special for a birthday or whatever.  Portions are ample.

data.title: Casual Greek Dining in Kent
data.text: This is a go to place for Greek food in historic downtown Kent. In an old downtown building with café style seating this place serves large amounts of food at reasonable prices and the service is friendly. A full bar offers some exotic drinks as well as a variety of wines and beers. Unfortunately they do not offer non alcoholic beer.

data.title: Good Food!
data.text:
I hadn't had Greek food since I moved from Seattle almost 18 years ago.   I wasn't disappointed !  It was as good as I remember.  The portions were large and favorable.
The only downside was that they were out of baklava !

data.title: Salad Dressing worth it's wait in gold
data.text: This is my all time favorite restaurant! DELICIOUS food! This is my go to for special occasions or anytime someone says "your choice".  I only wish that the service matched the product. One day they had a late delivery (I found out later) so didn't open at their regular time, but instead of posting a sign for customers they just left the doors locked and watched me as I waited outside and waved, knocked...and waited. I would have at least appreciated a quick explanation-I SAW YOU WATCHING ME! You're right...I'll be back, I love your salads too much to stay away...but don't expect a great tip.

data.title: I eat here a lot!
data.text: Greek is not my favorite food but it is my Mom's favorite and she loves this restaurant. I have tried several types of gyros which is what I enjoy and thier's are very good. I like to get the mixed meat which has lamb and beef (I find just lamb too strong and beef too routine.) Good value and wonderful wait staff that are very helpful if needed to decide what you want.

data.title: Good Greek Food
data.text: Spiro's has good Greek food. The atmosphere is fun on Saturday nights sine they have belly dancers. I love their traditional Greek salads, my husband likes their gyro's.

data.title: Great little Greek Resturant.
data.text: New Years eve dinner was great. Try anything made with the shaved lamb shank. Pita bread was fresh and the salad was outstanding. The Calamari appetizer was the most tender I have ever eaten! The next time in, we might just order two Calamari's appetizer's and wine and call it good. The only issue was the baked halibut was a bit overcooked but it had excellent flavor and texture. We will return soon. Also heard the lunch specials are the best.

data.title: Best GREEK food in South King County
data.text: You will not find a better place to get GREEK food, not Mediterranean food, in all of South King County.  I have been going here for about 14 years now and have never been disappointed with the food.  It can be lout and crowded on the weekends however, due to the belly dancers.  So plan on going on a week night and you will find great parking and a nice enjoyable quite meal.

data.title: Don't say I didn't warn ya.
data.text: Ate here on 10/5/2014. Apparently my specific description of the nastiness found within this restaurant falls into the description of health code violations so I'll be general. There were gnats in the salad, sewer flies landing on us, spoiled lamb in my souvlaki - but since I don't want this removed I will say I cannot prove that the violent case of puking that ensued hours after eating here was due to their food. Despite that, I would still not recommend eating here unless you really enjoy projectile vomiting. I hadn't eaten ANYTHING else that day other than some dry cereal (no milk) so I believe there is a relationship between eating here and throwing up, but I can't prove it, just a "gut" feeling...ha ha ha.
